causing bottleneck in a ring topology is advantage how??? explain

First of all, thankyou so much for the lecture delivery.I had a question it creates bottlenecks due to weak links in ring topology which limits the data flow then how is that an advantage? @nesoacademy
Which apply you use and how😊😊❤❤

The weak link in a ring topology can indeed cause a bottleneck and is considered as disadvantage not an advantage. If the link fails or becomes overloaded, it can disrupt the entire network's functionality. This limitation can lead to slower data transmission, increased latency, and potential network downtime.

@NomanKhan-nk5fs  sure so in bus topology, we have a single line of transmission connecting all the different nodes right ? so a single point of failure in any of those nodes will affect the entire transmission line.  Meanwhile in ring, each port connects to the other ports with the help of a dedicated line and so a point of failure in one line wouldn’t affect the transmission in the other.  Also, in bus topology, if the common bus line is not-working then the entire transmission shuts down, which is not the case in ring. There fore, it’s better.  Also !!  transmission  is faster  in ring topology since every transmission is independent of the other.
@dafeels  and in ring topology in advantage it's mentioned creates bottleneck.

Ring topology has common transmission media in closed loop  so it is similar to bus topology as it also has common transmission media  but not in closed loop.From the name itself you can find the ring topology's structure... it could be in a ring structure.... and so it's unidirectional.

Lets assume that a ring topology is bidirectional. A node can transmit data in both direction which will result in the end node receiving the same data twice. Eventually you will choose to send data in a fixed direction making it unidirectional.
I think he meant that transmission medium can be used to send and receive the data between same two nodes.
"A" node will send the data through medium(terminator) and other nodes can receive data
This protocol IS followed in bus topology. That's the reason other nodes reject the data that are not meant to be for them.
